More Notes: Additional virtual water trade flows from the USA (2.5 km3) and Argentina (1.8 km3) in 1992 compared to 1991 to alleviate drought impacts in Southern Africa.
Peak water savings from food trade reached in 2005, followed by a drop to 0.3 km3/y in 2007.
Maize trade savings were significant in 2008-2009, noted comparison to other years where such savings remained below 1.5 km3/y. Using the first year of the range.
